content:
tom HallFebruary  

Election changes

After much debate and amendment the Board approved this years election packet almost unanimously PERIOD Nearly a dozen amendments were presented most of which passed PERIOD Proposed amendments ranged from ending debate on the matter and immediately voting to taking a 10minute recess to discuss the matter informally. pERIOD

Among the notable amendments a provision to keep the polls open later on election days was passed PERIOD At three of the five polling places students can vote from  a.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD on the first day of voting and from  a.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD on the second and final day of voting PERIOD

Executive Vice President Luke Woods provided the lone vote of dissent in the vote to approve the election packet PERIOD He was concerned with the section of the packet dealing with election complaints PERIOD

Slate system takes a small hit avoids another

Two resolutions regarding slate campaigning reform were dealt mixed results. pERIOD

The legislation that was passed written by Postbaccalaureate Director Mohamed Hamada will restrict ASI candidates from printing more than one candidates name on any promotional piece of campaigning materials including flyers posters and signs PERIOD

According to Hamada this change helps strengthen the ability of independent candidates to compete against slateoriented candidates PERIOD The legislation allows the candidates to include a slate name or logo on the promotional material PERIOD

Hamada also wrote the slate reform legislation that failed PERIOD The legislation concerned having Lobby Corps take over campaign funding PERIOD It did not receive a second. pERIOD

Committees created

Legislation by Vice President of Finance Peter Ucovich led to the creation of two committees PERIOD A committee to investigate the creation of an ASIsponsored book exchange program was created as was one to research the expansion of KSSUs exposure PERIOD The KSSU committee will present their findings to the board on April  PERIOD

Your donation will support the student journalists of Sacramento State University PERIOD Your contribution will allow us to purchase equipment and cover our annual website hosting costs PERIOD
